page.description: Retrieve the syntax handler source for an example syntax handler.
page.discussion: The .GetExampleSyntaxScript() method returns reference material useful when creating a custom syntax handler for AlphaDAO objects. A user can implement a syntax script in its entirety by implementing all functions in the template and placing them in a text file in the Alpha Five binary folder called A5SQLSyntax<shortname>.ASQ . Syntax scripts saved this way will show up in the SQL::Connection::ListSyntaxes() function. Individual functions can be overridden by coding them in a string and calling SQL::Connection::SetSyntaxHandlerScript() on the connection to be affected. Only one script is allowed at a time.
page.example: dim conn as SQL::Connection conn.open("{A5API=Access,FileName='C:\Program Files\A5V8\MDBFiles\Alphasports.mdb',UserName='Admin'}") ? conn.GetExampleSyntaxScript() = ' Syntax Generation Script Example Script ' ' ' This script is provided without warranty for your use in creating a custom syntax handler for Alpha Anywhere Data Access Objects ' ...
